title: How to Make Garri (Cassava Flour) from Raw Cassava

steps.headline: Peel off the skin of the cassava tubers.
steps.description: Try as much as possible not to peel too deep

steps.headline: Wash the peeled tubers.
steps.description: Use a lot of water because this is the only washing you are going to do.

steps.headline: Cut the tubers into medium sizes.
steps.description: This is because they are going to be ground in a grinding machine. Smaller sizes increases the speed.

steps.headline: Take them to the machine (usually a very large one) and grind them.
After the grinding, the cassava powder (still watery) need to be packed in long bags and drilled to ultimate dryness in a jack for 2-3 days.
Using a wide sieve, sieve off the fine cassava powder from other particles.
Then, using a wide frying pan, fry the powder in reasonable portions until it becomes very dry and brittle (see the picture above).
Pack your garri in a dry place, and start enjoying your meal.
